titlepage.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlepage.author: Sara Street, Class of 2001
titlepage.sponsor: Encoding funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: The College Archives is home to over six hundred artifacts which supplement the documentary and photographic history of Smith College. The Artifacts Collection includes Smith College, class, and club pins and jewelry, Reunion paraphernalia, house banners and t-shirts, samples of the Smith Wedgwood china, Smith College Relief Unit mementos, souvenirs from special events, and countless other objects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The College Archives is home to over six hundred artifacts which supplement the documentary and photographic history of Smith College. They range in date from 1879 to the present; some cannot be precisely dated. The Artifacts Collection includes Smith College, class, and club pins and jewelry, Reunion paraphernalia, house banners and t-shirts, samples of the Smith Wedgwood china, Smith College Relief Unit mementos, souvenirs from special events, and countless other objects-many of which resist easy categorization.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Every artifact has been assigned a Registration Number. It is used to catalogue and assign a location to the artifact, and bears no relation to the type of artifact, its date, or the date of its acquisition. The register is arranged numerically by registration number. Because of this, the paper copy of the register is useful largely for casual browsing, and the keyword-searchable computer file should be used for directed searches.

The following abbreviations are used in the register:
Bx = Artifacts Box
Pn = Pin/Jewelry Box
Ft = Flat Box
LDC = Lounge Display Case
LSC = Lounge Spoon Case
Sm = Small Box
A91 or A91a = Archivists' Offices
Jnx = Joannex (for objects too large to be boxed)

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to researchers according to the regulations of the College Archives. Any material relating to the addresses of the artifacts' donors is restricted.

userestrict.p: Permission is required for publication beyond "fair use."

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Artifacts Register, Box #, Smith College Archives.

accruals.head: Additions to the Collection
accruals.p: Periodic additions to the collection are expected.

acqinfo.p: The artifacts in the Register were donated by various sources over a long period of time.

processinfo.p: Processed by Sara Street, Class of 2001.

Metal ring inscribed with "Annie E. Paret Smith College June 13, 1895" and "God bless this parchment".

Silvery medal on white ribbon trimmed in red and blue with blue star. On front of medal: 2 figures. Back is inscribed "Reconnaissance Francaise". Medals were awarded by the French government to "Vaillantes Femmes du Smith College" for WWI service in France (Smith College Relief Unit). Recipient of this particular medal unknown.
Booklets (two) are metal-bound with paper pages. Names are written in for various dances. One attached to cord for wear around neck.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Mrs. Harry H. Motheral.

scopecontent.p: Mary Maples Dunn Inauguration Commemorative Cup. Base reads, "Smith College - Inauguration - Mary Maples Dunn - the eighth president - September 29, 1985" on one side and features a sunflower on the other.

scopecontent.p: Medallion depicts the Grecourt Gates and College Hall on one side, "SC" on reverse. Box containing keychain inscribed "With gratitude from the Central Illinois Smith Club".
Purple hand-blown glass. Designed by Muriel Crosby Willett 1924. Presented to each member of the Class of 1924 attending their 40th Reunion by MCW and her husband, Henry.
Blue with white design. Depicts a pile of papers with one last piece fluttering to the top of the pile (says "$152,000,000"). See accompanying documentation.

acqinfo.p: From Jon Roche in Advancement Services.

scopecontent.p: Detailed with representations of tuning keys and bass clef, topped by pennant with G-clef finial. Removed during Pierce Hall renovations, summer 1995. See accompanying documentation for sketch.

Celebrating 25th Anniversary of the Bridge Program. "25th Anniversary 1970-1995" on one side; "Bridge Program Smith College" on reverse.

White paper bag with braided handles. SC seal embossed in blue with "Vivat Academia" above and "Smith College" below. Given with box lunches at inauguration of Ruth J. Simmons as SC president, September 30, 1995.

scopecontent.p: Figure of Alice from Lewis Carroll's Alice in Wonderland. On a wooden stand. Details burned into wood. At figure's feet is carved "'03-'05". On figure's back and on bottom of stand is carved "SR 1905".

scopecontent.p: Reads "War Relief Antiques for the Smith College Unit in France". White background featuring American and French flags.

scopecontent.p: Lamp that started 1975 fire in Neilson Library. Melted/disfigured.

Plaque from picture of Grecourt Gates. Reads: "Chateau de Robecourt / Grecourt, France / Headquarters of Smith College Relief Unit 1917-1920 / Presented by the Unit in honor of its fiftieth anniversary / June 3, 1967".
Woven basket with yellow ribbon reading, "Smith College '29, 'We are for less toil'". Basket is natural color on bottom, green around top, and has red handle.

Hands from clock on College Hall clock tower. Four large, four small hands. Painted black with white and gold-leaf accents. Includes three small pieces broken off hands, which are in location at right. Larger pieces are on top shelf, 31E.

acqinfo.p: From Andy Anderson and Barbara Footman of Physical Plant when new hands installed on tower clock, fall 1995.95A-241

scopecontent.p: Three purple cloth sashes worn by members of Class of 1916 at various reunions.

Beige drawstring bag in heavy cotton, "SC" outlined in gold paint on front. Carried in Ivy Day parades. Two.
Conical. Removed from College Hall during renovations, Nov. 1995. Mended by Harold Anderson of Physical Plant (concrete patched and metal bar placed in core).
Sculpture by SC art professor Elliot Offner. Heron shown with wings outstretched. Identical to sculpture in Botanic Garden pool.

scopecontent.p: Two stamps featuring leaping gazelle and the year. Metal stamp mounted with nails on wooden blocks. Red ink residue on stamps.
Presidential Search Ctte t-shirt. Grey with black SC seal and words "Presidential Search Committee: 'The Ruth Finders'".
Scribed metal latches and mounts (two each). Removed during College Hall renovations, fall 1995.

acqinfo.p: From Gary Hartwell of Physical Plant.

scopecontent.p: Round button, photo image of PRL 1951 in center. Perimeter white with black letters: "Chair Extraordinaire". Created for the retirement of PRL as Chair of the Board of Trustees of SC.

From SC Women's Studies Dept. conference (Il)legitimate Knowledge: the Challenge of Interdisciplinarity. Front of white shirt features conference name, date, department, logo. Back features phrase "It's a disciplinary thing (you wouldn't understand it)".

acqinfo.p: From Susan Van Dyne of Women's Studies Dept. via Sherrill Redmon of Sophia Smith Collection

scopecontent.p: Black lenses, yellow frames. "Rally Day 1996" printed in black on left bow.

Beige background with image of stained-glass SC seal on front. Back reads, "Knowledge is power: Virtue is an angel, but she is a blind one, and must ask of Knowledge to show her the pathway that leads to her goal. -Sophia Smith 1796-1870." Used as an AC Program fundraiser in 1994. Designed by Cathy Jackman AC '95; quote selected by Maureen Horkan AC '95.

Given to attendees of the SC Libraries symposium "Books Illustrated: A Symposium Celebrating the Work of Ruth Mortimer" April 12-13, 1996. Small box covered with handmade paste paper. Inside lid is label with title and dates of symposium. Each box contains one origami crane and three haiku by Ruth Mortimer.
Two metal strips, each with two images of SC seal.

acqinfo.p: Sent anonymously to D. Vikre of NPRC.

scopecontent.p: Beige shirt with black and red lettering. Image of Sophia's head and "Founder, Smith College, Sophia Smith Bicentennial, 1796-1996" on front. Add'l text on reverse. Designed by Sophia Smith Bicentennial Ctte. Used as Ada Comstock Program fundraiser.

acqinfo.p: Ada Comstock Program via Marilyn Metzler, AC.

scopecontent.p: White shirt with black lettering: list of events from "Application" to "Reunion" on front; "Just Do It" and "Smith College" on reverse. 1996 Class T-shirt?

"Henshaw Class of 1953" engraved in center; etched rim. Originally in Henshaw House when it was the Spanish-language house.

scopecontent.p: Small tankard with handle. Engraved "In Memoriam 1958-1961".
Engraved "Henshaw House". "1961" stamped on base. Contains spirit lamp to heat contents. Originally part of Henshaw House silver service. See Item #281.

acqinfo.p: Hatfield Hall storage. From Alice Clemente, Spanish/Portuguese Dept., via Beth Marshall, 5/10/96.

scopecontent.p: From steps between Morrow and Comstock Houses. Reads: "These steps are given in memory of Marian Ramsey Ewing 1883-1922 by the Class of 1905".

acqinfo.p: From Gary Hartwell of Physical Plant.

scopecontent.p: Six-sided, conical base with pointed top. See accompanying documentation for sketch.

scopecontent.p: Sophia Smith Bicentennial key chain. Souvenir from SSB Symposium September 27-28, 1996.

Class of 1996 Senior Pub Crawl T-shirt. Reads "The Evolution of a Senior".
AASC. Pin is gold and in the shape of a cicada. See Item #12.

acqinfo.p: Given by Louisa Shire Nathan 1941. Belonged to her aunt, A. Becker, of Chicago.

scopecontent.p: Depicting College Hall/Grecourt Gates in green in center of plate; cream border with raised pattern.

acqinfo.p: From Clarence Darrow Octagon House, Kinsman, OH. Given to Darrow House by Eleanor Brown, niece of Helen Cobb 1916.

scopecontent.p: 16.9 oz. bottle of water with SC label. Distributed during 1997 Commencement wknd and for sale on campus thereafter.

acqinfo.p: Sherrill Redmon of Sophia Smith Coll.

scopecontent.p: Yellow collapsible seats which, when folded, serve as canes. "1901" printed on seat. Used at unspecified reunion.

acqinfo.p: From Dean of College's Office. Separated from larger accession.

scopecontent.p: White, short-sleeved. On front: suffragist propaganda picture of woman climbing ladder. On reverse: "Revealing Life Stories: the First Fifty Years of the Sophia Smith Collection 1942-1992".
Head of New Students T-shirt. Blue, short-sleeved. On front: "Here to Help" in English, ASL, Thai, Spanish, German, and Russian. On reverse: "HONS (Heads of New Students) Smith College".
Reads "Preludes: If you follow the rules, you miss all the fun". Covered with handprints. Possibly 1995.
Reads "Preludes: To boldly go where no man has gone before". With handprints.
Reads "Preludes 1994: Once in a lifetime". With handprints and signatures.
Described under #14. See accompanying documentation.
Standard Phi Beta Kappa key.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Katherine Stevens 1910. AASC via Helen W. Simonds, friend of Stevens.

scopecontent.p: Standard Phi Beta Kappa key. On gold chain.

Standard Phi Beta Kappa key. Came on black velvet ribbon which was discarded.
Parasol decorated with "83" and hand-painted peacock feather.
Pair. Picture of woman on each. Sold to the Class of 1945 to aid Russian War Relief. See accompanying documentation.
Gold diamond-shaped pin with "SC" in white enamel. See #411 for more information.
Red tote bag with handle. "26" on side. Used at 45th reunion of Class of 1926.
Black with gold highlights. Mascot for Class of 1921.
White mug. "Smith College Founded 1871" and Grecourt logo in blue.
Black handle; purple cloth umbrella. Used at 55th reunion of Class of 1912. Theme: "The Great Society."
Black handle with yellow cloth umbrella.
Black handle with heavy yellow paper umbrella.
Batik purple banner with unicorn design by Deborah Davenport Brooks, daughter of Margery Witherell Davenport 1932.
White towel with black silkscreen of crew boat. Reads "For the benefit of Smith Rowing". Coxswain saying, "Can't you wait till we get back!" Made by Woodchips Designers, Martha's Vineyard, MA.
Reads "No woman can call herself free who does not own and control her body. Margaret Sanger 1920" on front, and "Smith Women, National March for Women's Equality-Women's Lives. April 9, 1989".
White with white SC logos silkscreened on cotton, dacron, or broadcloth. Sold for $6/yard, made by Natalie Galbreath Aust 1943, 8300 Bardmoor Blvd. Largo, FL 33543.
SC buildings and scenes depicted in pink and cream.
SC buildings and scenes depicted in green and cream.
Turquoise with white lettering "Smith College / Gilletts Dance".
White with pink and black writing: "Gillett House, 1993-94, Smith College" on front; "The Gillett, No Vacancy" on reverse.
Rally Day banner in imitation of Michaelangelo's Sistene Chapel: Sophia Smith reaches out to touch Eve's finger. Reads "Celebrare Visum Sophiae-Domus Morris MCMXCVI". Won prize.
Celebrating Sophia Smith Bicentennial. Reads "Celebrating Sophia's Vision and Ours! Education, Empowerment, Community, Growth, Friendship, Future, Class of 1997". Won prize.

Reads "Looking Ahead, Looking Back - 'If I put a little strength to oversome the difficulty the mountain would be removed, and I should have strength to make still further progress and I should more easily conquer difficulties' -Sophia Smith". Won prize.
White bag with green print reading "Smith College Centennial 1875-1975".
Orange plate, #2.
T-shirt for Wesleyan-Smith journal Meridians: feminism, race, transnationalism.

scopecontent.p: Image of College Hall in bowl with initials "M.A." on face.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Clara Louise Curtiss 1918. Given by Sarah Strong Clapp 1950.

scopecontent.p: Teal shirt reads "Jill Ker Conway / President / Smith College / Northampton, MA. A Decade of Down Under on Top 1975-1985".
Name "Paula"-Paula Sharp - x51.
"Smith College" on handle.
White fan with handpainted design of owl and shield. Sequins sewn on as part of design. Owl was Class of 1892 symbol. Used at a reunion.
Blue with green numbers "1907". Green griffin on right sleeve. White collar with green trim. Collar attaches with hooks and buttons. Owner wrote inside collar the years she played.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Margaret D. Coe Blake 1907. From Helen (Mimi) Moog Cary 1941, whose mother, Helen Moodey 1907, was friends with Margaret.

scopecontent.p: Purple with white numbers "1924" and border, gold fringe. Used at reunions?
Rectangular, purple with white "24".

Prison uniform (shirt and hat) used in 40th Reunion skit of Class of 1924. Horiz. purple and white stripes, fits over head, card with "1924" on it in purple stapled to top. Hat small and round, canvas.
Yellow and black squishy fish. Reads "Back to Paradise…Smith College Class of 1989 10th Year Reunion May 20-23 1999." Two fish.
Yellow and black fish. 10th year reunion of Class of 1989.
Black with white SC logo.
Class of 1989 10th Reunion keychain. Gold with black box, "Smith College Class of 1989 10th Year Reunion". See accompanying documentation.
White with caricatures of Nancy Reagan and Barbara Bush on front. Back reads: "There must be a better way to get a Smithie in the White House!"
White with yellow and black print: "Smith 1989".
Pink. Front features arrow pointing to shoulder and words in black, "Place head here". Reverse reads "Head Residents Smith College 1988-89".
Green, with outstretched wings. Class of 1907 mascot?
"This is About Smith" on front. From 1999 Capital Campaign. Olive.
"This is About Smith" on front and back. From 1999 Capital Campaign. Beige.
"This is About Smith" on beige.
"This is About Smith" on one side of white, shiny little bag.
Image of a woman playing golf.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Mary Louise Keller 1896. Given by Rosamond Horton Lownes 1954.

White with Smith stickers on front and sides and "Mary Dunn" on brim.
Reads "Our African Heritage-Remembering Not to Forget. Keynote Speaker Attallah Shabazz" in red and black paint.
Each student attending Preludes drew an outline of her hand on the cloth, decorated it and then signed her name.
Reads, "Our future's so bright, Sophia would have to wear shades".
Small chair that collapses into a cane. Used for Class of 1919 Reunion. Green with "1919" on seat.

White background with gold-and-white SC diamond in middle.
Roll for song "The Smith College March and Two-Step" by E. M. Blake 1896. Manufactured by the Aeolian Co., 18 W. 23rd St. NYC. Roll # 8082. CA has sheet music for song in 52. Music SC Songs.
Reads, "Dewey Women-Do We Ever!-Welcome". To welcome new students the last year that Dewey served as student housing. Signed by the upperclasswomen who lived there.

Yellow background with black lettering. Used in campaign to stop the planned destruction of Alumnae Gym.

Black and white featuring New Yorker cartoon with two women at table saying "Isn't it wonderful to feel that once a Smith girl, always a Smith girl?"

Yellow, green, and blue background with black lettering. Reads "I speak to challenge you. You challenge me by speaking."
Gold diamond-shaped pin with "SC" in white enamel. See Item #411 for more information. In original Tiffany box.
Seal in gold surrounded by white enamel with "Smith College 1871" and the college motto in Greek around the edge in gold. See accompanying documentation.

scopecontent.p: Owl with outstretched wings on stick. "Greek Club" on banner across owl.

Diamond-shaped "SC" on stick.

acqinfo.p: From estate of Mary E. Storer 1912. Given by Mrs. Joel Care Elty, 9/81.

scopecontent.p: Wishbone on stick. Worn on Commencement dress of M. Gail Tritch 1906. Other significance unknown.
Gold diamond-shaped pin with "SC" in white enamel. See #411 for more information.
Seal in gold surrounded by white enamel with "Smith College 1871" and the college motto in Greek around the edge in gold.
Seal in gold with "Smith College 1871" and the college motto in Greek around the edge.
Black enamel triangle in gold setting with gold "S" in center. Two tiny pearls set on each side of triangle.
Owl with outstretched wings and gemstone eyes encircled by snakes, also with gemstone eyes. See accompanying documentation.
Head of unicorn. Given (by whom?) to members of Class of 1924 at 50th Reunion dinner.
Complex, four-sided design with circle in center. "SC" in center encircled by inscription "Prodesse quam conspici" with letters "CLIO" on four sides. Perhaps a history club? Significance unknown.
Black shield with seven stars and Greek letters Kappa Delta in gold.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Clara (Senior) Iglauer 1907. Sent by dau. Laura I. Young, 6/23/80.

scopecontent.p: "P" overtop "C". Significance unknown.

Hat pin with sphere on top; studded with purple stones. Significance unknown.
Seal in gold surrounded by white enamel with "Smith College 1871" and the college motto in Greek around the edge in gold.

acqinfo.p: Given at Reunion by Marion Preston 1942, 5/24/02.

scopecontent.p: Gold-painted frame with paper inside. "Gertrude Tubby '02" on paper.

acqinfo.p: Removed from 22. Buildings, Tenney House Round Robin

scopecontent.p: Yellow background with black lettering. Used in campaign to stop the planned destruction of Alumnae Gym.
Silver ring with onyx/black enamel setting. Seal set into onyx.
Modelled after the Phi Beta Kappa Key, with black enamel face and SC seal set in gold in center. "Smith College AD 1871" and Greek motto around seal.
Modelled after the Phi Beta Kappa Key with large Greek Sigma on face. Given to Mary Louise Foster 1891 by U. of Chicago? in 1914. Significance unknown.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Mary Louise Foster 1891. Sent by Mary Foster Kingimill 4/1/77.

scopecontent.p: Shape of a feather/quill. See accompanying documentation under #417.
Standard Phi Beta Kappa Key. See accompanying documentation under #417.
Silver-plated oval charm with Alumnae Association logo and "Alumnae Association of Smith College 1881."
Silver seal encircled by black enamel inscribed with "Smith College AD 1871" and Greek motto in silver.
Diamond-shaped flat surface with "SC" and either "02" or "20".

acqinfo.p: Envelope in which ring was found reads "Hannah Scharps 1906" but ring appears to be from either 1902 or 1920 and has the initials K.A. inscribed.

scopecontent.p: Seal in silver with while enamel around edge. "Smith College AD 1871" and Greek motto in gold.
Beige handbag with cream satin lining. Red felt circle on front with "94" in white. Used at an 1894 Class Reunion.
White cotton t-shirt with "Theatre 14," "Smith College Theatre Department," and names and dates of plays in yellow and black.
Cream canvas with red handles. Flower design and Theatre Dept. 1984-85 season play titles printed in purple.
Cream canvas with navy blue trim, handles, and print, featuring 1983-84 season play titles. Extra-long handles.
Class of 1937 30th Reunion costume: yellow skirt, handbag, and headband with ruler pattern on all pieces.
Blue t-shirt with white lettering. Reads "We're Moving 84ward. Smith College." White banner found with t-shirt has identical lettering without "Smith College," and has been discarded.
Class of 1933 first reunion costume plastic yellow hood and handbag. Nametags in shape of umbrellas. See accompanying documentation.

acqinfo.p: Pulled from 80. Class of 1933 records. Nametags are for H. Hansen and E. Sturgis.

scopecontent.p: Class of 1943 20th Reunion costume: green canvas "tool belt" with toold printed in white in pockets. "43" in center.
Class of 1943 10th Reunion costume: large four-fingered green mitt.
Class of 1943 30th Reunion costume (part): green beads on green cord.
Class of 1943 25th Reunion costume (part): green prize ribbon with white paper center. Blank.
Class of 1943 Reunion prop: green bubble pipe with white stem.

note.p: gob of lip- stick on end

scopecontent.p: Class of 1943 Reunion prop: green and white button reading "I like 43".
Class of 1944 30th Reunion hat: blue 45 with attachments to tie to head.
Class of 1944 10th Reunion hat: purple mortarboard with white tassle. "44" on front in white.
Class of 1944 Reunion bag: navy blue with white trim. Round, like bowling bag.
Class of 1946 45th Reunion bag: red canvas with white image of Dewey and "1946 This, The House We Live In" in white.
Class of 1946 Reuniun favor: watch with black band, white face, image of Dewey and "1946" in red. In black case.
Two-piece red gym suit (heavy jumpsuit, v-neck sweater) and tennis-dress-style bathing suit.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Dorothy M. Watson 1942. Rec'd 5/23/97.

scopecontent.p: Oval-shaped purple straw fan decorated with flowers and ribbon. Significance unknown.
Green button with "Smith 1931" in black and strip of silver reflective tape in center. Reunion prop?
Block of carved wood commemorating Pompeiana exhibit, SCMA, 1948-49.
Two wooden hand-dumbbells. See accompanying documentation.
Copper stamp block with "The Washburn House" in reverse type.
Nameplate from portrait of Ellen Emerson Davenport 1901.
Brick-red felt with "Smith" in white.
Depicting Wilson House and Neilson Library (two plates) in rose in center of plate; cream border with raised pattern.

acqinfo.p: Belonged to Lois Hall 1930. Given by Faith Barrington 6/2001.

scopecontent.p: Depicting College Hall in blue in center of plate; cream border with raised pattern.

acqinfo.p: From New England Province Archives, Hadi Marshall.

scopecontent.p: Entire set of dinner plates in rose. Depicting College Hall, Grecourt Gates, Sage Hall, Paradise Pond, John M. Greene Hall, Lanning Fountain, Sophia Smith Homestead, Dewey House, Seelye Hall, the Observatory, Wilson House, Neilson Library. Featuring Neilson's signature.
Seal surrounded by white, etc.
white asian style robe with short sleeves and yellow trim on sleeve cuffs and along front opening. Has black print on back of a circle with the letters SC in the middle and 1905.

physdesc.dimensions: purse 7.5" x 6.5" mittens 7.5" x 5.5" flower? bulb 8" x 12" stem 4.5 ft.

scopecontent.p: Class of 1953 reunion costume -flat yellow purse with black bee on front flap with numerals 53 in its wings - 2 yellow cloth mittens with "53" in black on each -yellow cloth item which most closely resembles a flower with a long cloth stuffed stem

did.unittitle: Banners created for peace demonstration after September 11, 2001 attacks on the World Trade Center in NY and the Pentagon in Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.p: each square piece of cloth is a different color and carries a different message and they are all stapled to a long piece of purple cloth that was a shirt cut into strips and tied together.
